Class CalendarDay

  • java.lang.Object
    • CalendarDay

  • public class CalendarDay
extends java.lang.Object

    CalendarDay Week

    Contains an array of events and a String "dayOfWeek"

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalendarDay

        public CalendarDay(int d,
           java.lang.String m)

        Calendar Day Constructor

        Creates a Calendar Day object based on the given date and month that stores its day of the week and events for the day

        Parameters:
        d - - int: date of month (1,2...31)
        m - - String: name of CalendarMonth that CalendarDay belongs to
        See Also:
        CalendarMonth

    • Method Detail

      • setDayOfWeek

        public void setDayOfWeek(java.lang.String dow)
        Sets the dayOfWeek variable in the CalendarDay object.

        Returns nothing.

        Parameters:
        dow - - String: Day of week (Sunday...Saturday)

      • getDate

        public int getDate()
        Returns the date as an integer from the CalendarDay object.
        Returns:
        the date of the given CalendarDay

      • getFilePath

        public java.lang.String getFilePath()

      • getMonth

        public java.lang.String getMonth()
        Returns the month as a string from the CalendarDay object.
        Returns:
        the month that the given CalendarDay belongs to.

      • getDayOfWeek

        public java.lang.String getDayOfWeek()
        Returns the day of the week (Sunday...Saturday) from the CalendarDay object.
        Returns:
        day of week as string of the given CalendarDay

      • getEvents

        public java.lang.String getEvents()
        Returns the events of the given day as a string to be displayed as a list.
        Returns:
        A string of all events concatenated together.

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent(java.lang.String event)
        Adds a new event to the CalendarDay's array of events and writes the event to specific CalendarDay's month file.

        Event can be any String the user wants to put.

        Parameters:
        event - - Any String the user wants stored to the specific CalendarDay

      • addEventToArray

        public void addEventToArray(java.lang.String event)
        Adds the event to the CalendarDay's array to be used for display and record purposes.
        Parameters:
        event - - The given string from addEvent that is to be added to the day
        See Also:
        addEvent

      • removeEvent

        public void removeEvent(int event)
        Removes event from the CalendarDay's events array and from its corresponding month file.

        Function always ends if user requests to remove an event that is not within the list of events, either 0 or a value greater than the known number of events.

        Parameters:
        event - - Number from list of events user wants to remove.

      • removeEventFromArray

        public void removeEventFromArray(int event)
        Removes the event at the given index from the CalendarDay's event array.
        Parameters:
        event - - index of the event to be removed from array. Will always be valid.

      • loadDayEvents

        public void loadDayEvents()
        Loads in events from the day's month file into its event array

        Prints out an error if the file stops existing or encounters an error for any reason.

      • getEventCount

        public int getEventCount()
        Gets the number of events in the day's event array
        Returns:
        int - day's event array length
